snippet: The company said that unless it raised $20 million by year’s end, it would abandon its 2014-15 season.
abstract: New York City Opera, founded 70 years ago to bring opera to the masses, says it will be forced to cancel most of its current season and all of its next season if it fails to raise $20 million by year's end; very survival of company that made art form accessible and cultivated important singers is threatened.
lead_paragraph: The company said that unless it raised $20 million by year’s end, it would abandon its 2014-15 season.

headline.main: New York City Opera May Cancel Most of This Season
headline.print_headline: City Opera Warns of Wide Cancellations if Fund-Raising Lags
